alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 11:13AM EDT until August 04 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High water caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...From this morning to early Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.6 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued by 10 PM.
